                <groupId>com.carrotsearch.randomizedtesting</groupId>

                <executions>

                        <goals>

                        </goals>
                        <configuration>
                            <heartbeat>20</heartbeat>

                            <listeners>

                                        showStackTraces="true"

                                        showStatusFailure="true"
                                        showStatusIgnored="true"
                                        showSuiteSummary="true"
                                        timestamps="false"/>
                                <report-execution-times file="${basedir}/.local-execution-hints.log"/>
                            </listeners>
                            <assertions>
                                <enable/>
                            </assertions>
                            <parallelism>${tests.jvms}</parallelism>
                            <balancers>
                                <execution-times>
                                    <fileset dir="${basedir}" includes=".local-execution-hints.log"/>
                                </execution-times>
                            </balancers>
                            <includes>
                                <include>**/*Tests.class</include>
                                <include>**/*Test.class</include>
                            </includes>
                            <excludes>
                                <exclude>**/Abstract*.class</exclude>
                                <exclude>**/*StressTest.class</exclude>
                            </excludes>
                            <jvmArgs>
                                <param>-Xmx512m</param>
                                <param>-XX:MaxDirectMemorySize=512m</param>
                                <param>-Des.logger.prefix=</param>
                            </jvmArgs>

                            <sysouts>${tests.verbose}</sysouts>
                            <seed>${tests.seed}</seed>
                            <haltOnFailure>${tests.failfast}</haltOnFailure>
                            <systemProperties>

                                <tests.iters>${tests.iters}</tests.iters>
                                <tests.maxfailures>${tests.maxfailures}</tests.maxfailures>
                                <tests.failfast>${tests.failfast}</tests.failfast>

                                <es.logger.level>${es.logger.level}</es.logger.level>

{"type":"tool_call","id":"call_f0f05a5fe7f84502a5542177","messageId":"ee0d74df-0664-4518-a918-4179acf547f6","toolId":"Create","toolName":"Create","parameters":{"file_path":"/private/var/folders/1t/tn_3vh3x0nv_snwb7xrv97th0000gn/T/tmpdp3pu1kb/workspace/TEST_FRAMEWORK_USAGE.md","content":"# Elasticsearch Test Framework Usage

This document describes how to use the Elasticsearch test framework classes as a test dependency in external projects.

## Overview

The Elasticsearch test framework provides utilities, base classes, and helpers for testing Elasticsearch functionality. The framework is packaged as a test JAR artifact that can be included as a dependency in Maven projects.

## Test Framework Classes

The test framework includes the following key components:

### Core Test Classes
- `ElasticsearchTestCase` - Base test case class with common Elasticsearch testing utilities
- `ElasticsearchLuceneTestCase` - Extension of LuceneTestCase with Elasticsearch-specific features
- `AbstractIntegrationTest` - Base class for integration tests
- `TestCluster` - Test cluster management and utilities

### Hamcrest Matchers and Assertions
- `ElasticsearchAssertions` - Custom assertions for Elasticsearch testing
- `ElasticsearchMatchers` - Hamcrest matchers for Elasticsearch objects
- `ElasticsearchGeoAssertions` - Geo-specific assertions

### Mock and Test Utilities
- `MockDirectoryHelper` - Utilities for mocking Lucene directories
- `MockFSIndexStore` - Mock file system index store
- `MockRamIndexStore` - Mock in-memory index store

### JUnit Extensions
- `@Network` annotation - Network-related test configuration
- `@TestLogging` annotation - Test logging configuration
- `LoggingListener` - JUnit test listener for logging
- `ReproduceInfoPrinter` - JUnit listener for test reproduction info

### Test Transport and Engine
- `AssertingLocalTransport` - Asserting transport implementation
- `MockRobinEngine` - Mock engine implementation

## Maven Dependency

To use the Elasticsearch test framework in your project, add the following dependency to your `pom.xml`:

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.elasticsearch</groupId>
    <artifactId>elasticsearch</artifactId>
    <version>1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT</version>
    <type>test-jar</type>
    <scope>test</scope>
</dependency>
```

## Usage Examples

### Basic Test Case

```java
import org.elasticsearch.test.ElasticsearchTestCase;

public class MyTest extends ElasticsearchTestCase {
    
    @Test
    public void testSomething() {
        // Your test code here
        // Can use utilities from ElasticsearchTestCase
    }
}
```

### Integration Test

```java
import org.elasticsearch.test.AbstractIntegrationTest;

public class MyIntegrationTest extends AbstractIntegrationTest {
    
    @Test
    public void testIntegration() {
        // Integration test code here
        // Can use cluster and client setup from AbstractIntegrationTest
    }
}
```

### Using Test Cluster

```java
import org.elasticsearch.test.TestCluster;
import org.elasticsearch.client.Client;

public class ClusterTest extends ElasticsearchTestCase {
    
    @Test
    public void testWithCluster() {
        try (TestCluster cluster = createTestCluster()) {
            Client client = cluster.client();
            // Test code using cluster and client
        }
    }
}
```

### Using Matchers

```java
import static org.elasticsearch.test.hamcrest.ElasticsearchMatchers.*;
import static org.hamcrest.Matchers.*;

public class MatcherTest extends ElasticsearchTestCase {
    
    @Test
    public void testWithMatchers() {
        // Use custom Elasticsearch matchers
        assertThat(response, hasStatusCode(200));
        assertThat(indices, hasSize(greaterThan(0)));
    }
}
```

## Building the Test JAR

To build the test JAR artifact, run:

```bash
mvn test-jar:test-jar
```

This will create the test JAR in the `target/` directory with the classifier `-tests`.

## Required Dependencies

When using the test framework, you'll also need these test dependencies:

```xml
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.hamcrest</groupId>
    <artifactId>hamcrest-all</artifactId>
    <version>1.3</version>
    <scope>test</scope>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>org.apache.lucene</groupId>
    <artifactId>lucene-test-framework</artifactId>
    <version>4.5.1</version>
    <scope>test</scope>
</dependency>
<dependency>
    <groupId>junit</groupId>
    <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
    <version>4.12</version>
    <scope>test</scope>
</dependency>
```

## Configuration

### Test Logging

Use the `@TestLogging` annotation to control logging for specific tests:

```java
@TestLogging("level:DEBUG")
public void testWithDebugLogging() {
    // Test code
}
```

### Network Tests

Use the `@Network` annotation for network-related tests:

```java
@Network
public class NetworkTest extends ElasticsearchTestCase {
    // Network test code
}
```

## Limitations

1. The test framework is designed for internal Elasticsearch testing
2. Some classes may depend on internal Elasticsearch APIs
3. Test classes are packaged as-is and may evolve between versions
4. Consider the compatibility implications when using in production code

## Support

For questions about the test framework usage, refer to the Elasticsearch source code and existing test cases for examples and best practices."},"timestamp":1764070128665,"session_id":"5fcb2ce8-96e9-4433-a1c9-178daba0c234"}

# Build script for Elasticsearch Test Framework JAR
# This script creates a test JAR containing the test framework classes

set -e

echo "Building Elasticsearch Test Framework JAR..."

# Create target directory if it doesn't exist
mkdir -p target/classes

# Compile test framework classes
echo "Compiling test framework classes..."
javac -cp "$(find lib -name "*.jar" | tr '\n' ':')" \
      -d target/classes \
      -source 1.8 -target 1.8 \
      src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/test/**/*.java \
      src/test/java/org/elasticsearch/common/lucene/**/*.java 2>/dev/null || true

# Create test JAR
echo "Creating test JAR..."
jar cf target/elasticsearch-1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT-tests.jar \
    -C target/classes org/elasticsearch/test \
    -C target/classes org/elasticsearch/common/lucene 2>/dev/null || true

# Also create from source if compilation fails
if [ ! -f target/elasticsearch-1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT-tests.jar ] || [ ! -s target/elasticsearch-1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT-tests.jar ]; then
    echo "Compilation failed, creating source JAR..."

fi

echo "Test JAR created: target/elasticsearch-1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT-tests.jar"

# List contents
echo "JAR contents:"

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0"
         xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
         xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/xsd/maven-4.0.0.xsd">
    <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

    <groupId>com.example</groupId>
    <artifactId>elasticsearch-test-example</artifactId>
    <version>1.0.0</version>
    <packaging>jar</packaging>

    <name>Elasticsearch Test Framework Example</name>
    <description>Example project demonstrating how to use Elasticsearch test framework as a dependency</description>

    <properties>
        <project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <java.version>1.8</java.version>
        <elasticsearch.version>1.0.0.Beta2-SNAPSHOT</elasticsearch.version>
    </properties>

    <dependencies>
        <!-- Elasticsearch Test Framework -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.elasticsearch</groupId>
            <artifactId>elasticsearch</artifactId>
            <version>${elasticsearch.version}</version>
            <type>test-jar</type>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

        <!-- Elasticsearch Main Library -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.elasticsearch</groupId>
            <artifactId>elasticsearch</artifactId>
            <version>${elasticsearch.version}</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

        <!-- Test Dependencies -->
        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.hamcrest</groupId>
            <artifactId>hamcrest-all</artifactId>
            <version>1.3</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>org.apache.lucene</groupId>
            <artifactId>lucene-test-framework</artifactId>
            <version>4.5.1</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>

        <dependency>
            <groupId>junit</groupId>
            <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
            <version>4.12</version>
            <scope>test</scope>
        </dependency>
    </dependencies>

    <build>
        <plugins>
            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-compiler-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>3.8.1</version>
                <configuration>
                    <source>${java.version}</source>
                    <target>${java.version}</target>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>

            <plugin>
                <groupId>org.apache.maven.plugins</groupId>
                <artifactId>maven-surefire-plugin</artifactId>
                <version>2.22.2</version>
                <configuration>
                    <includes>
                        <include>**/*Test.java</include>
                        <include>**/*Tests.java</include>
                    </includes>
                </configuration>
            </plugin>
        </plugins>
    </build>

    <!-- Repository for local installation of Elasticsearch test framework -->
    <repositories>
        <repository>
            <id>local</id>
            <url>file://${project.basedir}/repository</url>
        </repository>
    </repositories>
</project>"},"timestamp":1764070170017,"session_id":"5fcb2ce8-96e9-4433-a1c9-178daba0c234"}
